page.title: 15The Nature Reserve at Norton
page.content: Near Ford Green Hall there is a nature reserve. It is a quiet place where people come to look at the birds and plants. Before it was waste land but now trees and grass have been planted to make it look nice. There is a foot- path which leads around the lake.In the lake are many water weeds as well as tiny fish which you are not allowed to catch. There are swans,ducks, coots and moorhens. The swan's nest is made of reeds and stands about a metre above the reed bed. This year one of the swans, named Charlie, was killed.Now there is only one swan and unless another swan is put in there will be no eggs next year. Nature reserves are places where you can have pleasure without paying any thing.This one has the added attraction of being next door to Ford Green Hall museum.
